meanings.definition: A book with a flexible paper or card cover.
meanings.sent1: I prefer reading softcover books because they are easier to hold.
meanings.sent2: The library had a wide selection of softcover novels.
meanings.sent3: My cat loves to nap on my softcover books, leaving tiny paw prints.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a softcover book, open for anyone to read.
meanings.sent5: The softcover fluttered in the wind like a gentle butterfly.

meanings.definition: To bind a book with a flexible paper or card cover.
meanings.sent1: I will softcover this report for a professional look.
meanings.sent2: She softcovers all her handmade journals with colorful paper.
meanings.sent3: The magician softcovered the book, making it disappear in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: His words softcover my heart, wrapping it in warmth.
meanings.sent5: Softcovering the album gave it a personalized touch.
